org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.cassandra.impl

Class CassandraDatastoreProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.spi.BaseDatastoreProvider
      • org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.cassandra.impl.CassandraDatastoreProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, DatastoreProvider, Service, Configurable, ServiceRegistryAwareService, Startable, Stoppable

    public class CassandraDatastoreProvider
extends BaseDatastoreProvider
implements Startable, Stoppable, ServiceRegistryAwareService, Configurable
    Datastore service layered on Cassandra's java-driver i.e. CQL3 native transport.
    Author:
    Jonathan Halliday
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • allowsTransactionEmulation

        public boolean allowsTransactionEmulation()
        Description copied from interface: DatastoreProvider
        Whether the underlying datastore allows emulation of transactions.

        Only of relevance if this provider does not return a custom TransactionCoordinatorBuilder from DatastoreProvider.getTransactionCoordinatorBuilder(TransactionCoordinatorBuilder).

        When transaction emulation is used, transactions only demarcate a unit of work. The transaction emulation will make sure that at commit time all required changes are flushed, but there are otherwise no true transaction, in particular rollback, semantics.

        Specified by:
        allowsTransactionEmulation in interface DatastoreProvider
        Overrides:
        allowsTransactionEmulation in class BaseDatastoreProvider
        Returns:
        true if the underlying datastore allows transaction emulation, false otherwise.
